answerText: RNA splicing [or word forms][10] The branch point, a structure required for splicing to occur, always contains this purine base.
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | Yale A + Minnesota A | 18 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The branch binding protein interacts with the region that will become the binding site for U2 during the preliminary steps of this process. For 10 points each: [10] Name this process, during which snRNPs (snurps) interact with pre-mRNA to catalyze the excision of introns.
